title: Beginning Ruby on Rails

description: The Ruby translation of Zed Shaw's popular Learn Python the Hard Way. It assumes no prior programming background with focus on reading and writing code.

description: The Ruby for the Nuby tutorial by Chris Pine is a good place to start for people that do not have prior programming experience. It's a short tutorial that you can go over in a few hours.

title: Ruby on Rails for Microsoft Developers
description: This definitive guide examines how to take advantage of the new Agile methodologies offered when using Ruby on Rails (RoR).

title: Practical JRuby on Rails Web 2.0 Projects: Bringing Ruby on Rails
description: Discover how JRuby on Rails can be used to create web applications faster and more efficiently while still taking advantage of the vast power of Ruby.

title: Ruby on Rails Tutorial and LiveLesson Video Bundle: Learn Web
description: Rails has rapidly become one of the world's most popular web development frameworks.

title: Rails Antipatterns: Best Practice Ruby on Rails Refactoring
description: The Complete Guide to Avoiding and Fixing Common Rails 3 Code and Design Problems As developers worldwide have adopted the powerful Ruby on Rails.

title: Ruby on Rails For Dummies
description: Quickly create Web sites with this poweful toolUse this free and easy programming language for e-commerce sites and blogsIf you need to build Web

description: Ruby on Rails is the super-productive new way to develop full-featured web applications.

title: Ruby on Rails Web Mashup Projects
description: This book is project-based. The format of each project is similar, with a statement of the project, discussion of the main protocols involved

title: Beginning Ruby on Rails E-Commerce: From Novice to Professional
description: Beginning Ruby on Rails E-Commerce: From Novice to Professional is the first book of its kind to guide you through producing e-commerce apps.

title: Professional Ruby on Rails
description: Nothing less than a revolution in the way web applications are constructed,Ruby on Rails (RoR) boasts a straightforward and intuitive nature.

title: Ruby on Rails Enterprise Application Development: Plan, Program
description: This book for developers familiar with Ruby on Rails who want to develop and roll out small applications deals with a key feature or function.

title: RailsSpace: Building a Social Networking Website with Ruby on Rails
description: Ruby on Rails is fast displacing PHP, ASP, and J2EE as the development framework of choice for discriminating programmers.

title: Flex on Rails: Building Rich Internet Applications with Adobe Flex
description: There’s no question you’re going to be a better Flex and Rails developer when you’re done reading this book. –From the Foreword by Matt Chotin

title: Ruby on Rails 3 Tutorial: Learn Rails by Example
description: Ruby on Rails 3 Tutorial: Learn Rails by Exampleby Michael Hartl has become a must read for developers learning how to build Rails apps.

title: Ruby on Rails Power!: The Comprehensive Guide
description: Ruby on Rails is a feature-rich, easy to learn, and powerful web application framework that makes creating sophisticated, full featured web site.

title: Using Ruby on Rails for Web Development, Introduction Guide
description: Ruby on Rails is a highly-productive and industrial-strength web application framework.

title: Ajax on Rails
description: Learn to build dynamic, interactive web applications using the two most important approaches to web development today.

title: How to Install Rails
description: A getting started guide on how to set up Rails in multiple environments, from the official Ruby on Rails site.

title: Fast-track your Web apps with Ruby on Rails
description: Fast-track your Web apps with Ruby on Rails is a somewhat dated but excellent overview of how the web framework works.

title: Ruby Study Notes
description: If you’re not familiar with the Ruby language, check out Ruby Study Notes, a web-based tutorial on the basics of Ruby.

title: Ruby in 20 Minutes
description: The official Ruby site has a quickstart that will get you well underway into Ruby programming.

title: Ruby on Rails Cheat Sheet
description: A quick reference for Rail’s directory structure, pre-defined variables, syntax and more.

title: Ruby on Rails Tutorial Part 1 - Getting Started
description: In this Ruby on Rails Blog Tutorial we'll work on getting a blogging application up and running, learn about the rails directory structure, and do a simple hello world. In this video I'm using Rails 3.1 and Ruby 1.9.2 on Linux.

title: Web Development with Ruby On Rails
description: The Ruby on Rails framework gives you the tools you need to develop web applications faster. In this webinar, you'll learn about the basic components of the Rails framework and see how to create and test a very simple web application that you can build upon. By the end you'll have an idea of how you can leverage Ruby on Rails in your work.

title: Your first Ruby on Rails Application
description: No fluff, just get to it - example of how to create a rails application, push it to GitHub source control, and to Heroku for cloud hosting.

title: Ruby on Rails 3 Tutorial Livelessons Bundle: Learn Rails
description: Use Michael Hartl's Acclaimed Video Lessons and Best-Selling Book Side by Side to Master Rails Fast! LiveLessons DVD with 18+ hours of video.

title: Ruby on Rails Bible
description: Thanks to the explosive growth in popularity of the Rails framework, the equally popular Ruby programming language now has a great place to hang.

title: Build Your Own Ruby on Rails Web Applications
description: Want to learn all about Ruby on Rails, the web application framework that is inspiring developers around the world?

title: Ruby on Rails for PHP and Java Developers
description: About the Author Deepak Vohra is an Oracle Certified Associate and a Sun Certified Java Programmer.

title: Yehuda Katz - Why Rails is Hard
description: European Rails Conference Railsberry 2012, Day 2

title: Stop Writing Classes
description: Classes are great but they are also overused. This talk will describe examples of class overuse taken from real world code and refactor the unnecessary classes, exceptions, and modules out of them.

title: Using AngularJS with Rails - NYC Meetup
description: Jonathan E. Magen (from WeWork) gives a presentation entitled The Accidental Feature or: Using Angular.js on top of Rails.

title: Ruby on Rails 101: What is Ruby on Rails?
description: Veracode Security Researcher Ryan O'Boyle educates us about Ruby on Rails. He answers the following questions: What is Ruby on Rails? What makes Ruby on Rails a popular framework?

title: Refactor HTML Site Template to Ruby on Rails
description: HTML website templates from wrapbootstrap.com are awesome, but they are static need massaging to be used in a ruby on rails application.

title: Riding Ruby on Rails -ActiveRecord Models-ActiveRecord-Associations
description: Been meaning to learn Ruby on Rails, but felt that it was too hard? Well, not anymore. In this course, José Mota will take you through the process of creating dynamic and creative web applications, using Ruby on Rails. Come join us for the ride.

title: Ruby on Rails - Part 4: Advanced Active Record
description: This is an intensive one-day overview of the fundamental concepts of the Ruby on Rails Web programming framework, presented by the UC Berkeley RAD Lab. The overview consists of six sections of approximately one hour each.

title: Ruby on Rails Code-Walkthrough/Tutorial
description: Here's a little Ruby on Rails tutorial for absolute beginners. Basically I go through the code of a Rails application and try to explain how it works.

title: Practicing Ruby
description: Practicing Ruby publishes fantastic articles every 2 weeks. The content tends to be intermediate to advanced in nature.

title: Ruby Learning
description: Free online tutorial, an e-book and an online Ruby course, covering the core concepts of Ruby programming language.

title: Ruby Koans
description: A set of exercises that lead to the enlightment of Ruby programming. Focuses on Ruby syntax, structure and common libraries. Good for experienced developers learning Ruby as another programming language.

title: Getting Started with Rails
description: This guide covers getting up and running with Ruby on Rails. After reading this guide, you will know: How to install Rails, create a new Rails application, and connect your application to a database. The basic principles of MVC (Model, View, Controller) and RESTful design.

title: David Heinemeier Hansson - Ruby on Rails, Startups, Culture
description: O'Reilly News talks to David Heinemeier Hansson about the current state of Ruby on Rails, what is next for the framework? and what Hansson is paying attention to? David also discusses his recent presentation at Y! Combinator's Startup School and his ideas about the culture of technology and innovation.

title: Big Ruby 2013 Services and Rails: The Shit They Don't Tell You
description: Building services and integrating them into Rails is hard. We want smaller Rails apps and nicely encapsulated services, but services introduce complexity. If you go overboard in the beginning, you're doing extra work and getting some of it wrong. If you wait too long, you've got a mess.

title: Aaron Peterson - Rails 4 and the Future of Web
description: What's new in Rails 4? How does Rails 4 fit in to the future of web development? Why are cats so important to the development of Ruby and Rails? All these questions and more will be answered if you attend this talk.

title: How To Create a Ruby On Rails Blog
description: This is a great way to show how simple it is to create a fairly complex application using Rails. However, you will see that, in order to generate this application it is necessary to switch many times between standalone text editors, database tools, file managers, web browsers and command prompts. Ruby In Steel can greatly simplify this by integrating the entire development process into Visual Studio. Here I will guide you through the steps to creating a simple Blog application which allows multiple comments to be associated with each blog post.
